intro: Canarina eminii var. elgonensis, commonly known as the East African canary tree, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of East Africa. It is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and its ability to thrive in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with ornamental value. It is often found in montane forests and is adapted to cool, humid climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
